data.title: Den Of Wax Launches Inaugural ‘First Fest’ on August 19th To Benefit LGBTQ+ Center In NY
data.meta_description: [Cover photo of Man on Man] Den of Wax, the newly launched online record store and boutique record label, which is also a soon-to-open brick-and-mortar retail storefront in Ossining, NY, has announced Den of Wax’s First Fest, a day-long benefit music event taking place on the grounds of the Bethany Arts Community in Ossining on…
data.text:
[Cover photo of Man on Man]

Den of Wax, the newly launched online record store and boutique record label, which is also a soon-to-open brick-and-mortar retail storefront in Ossining, NY, has announced Den of Wax’s First Fest, a day-long benefit music event taking place on the grounds of the Bethany Arts Community in Ossining on Saturday, August 19th, 2023.

The event, which is free to attend, with a suggested donation of $20.00 to The Loft LGBTQ+ Center, features a lineup of queer-affirming musicians, an assortment of food trucks, drinks, raffles and more.

Matt Friedman, co-owner, Den of Wax says:

I’ve had a lifelong passion for connecting people via music, so this event came about naturally as a way to help cultivate the Westchester music scene and gather the community.

I’m excited to introduce Den of Wax as the new family on the block by bringing together all of these great musicians – including long-time favorites, idols and personal friends – while raising awareness and funds for such an important cause. I want this annual event to celebrate music, embrace culture, and create a welcoming environment for every person to enjoy an incredible musical experience. This is at the core of what we want to achieve with Den of Wax.

Den of Wax has engaged a range of local businesses and organizations that are providing everything from promotion to sound equipment. Partners include The Capitol Theatre (the largest performance venue in Westchester County), Captain Lawrence Brewing Co., the county’s biggest brewery, The Koop Studio, School of Rock Briarcliff Manor, River Towns Music Group, and others.

The Lineup:

The Iron Roses (Joyful punk for inclusive revolutionaries)

MAN ON MAN (Unabashed queer rock band comprised of Roddy Bottum (Faith No More, Imperial Teen, Crickets) and Joey Holman (Holman))

Rid of Me (Melodic noise punk from Philly)

Jose Prieto of MakeWar (Solo acoustic set from frontman of NYC punk outfit signed to Fat Wreck Chords)

Chris Conde (Subversive queer rapper out of Brooklyn, NY)

All My Friends (Ossining, NY punks combining elements of throwback NYC punk with a touch of ‘90s alterna rock)

For Lack Of A Term (Alt-Punks from Yonkers, NY)

The Bump (Horrorfolk/Metalcoustic)
